intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. finmarkicum, commonly known as the Finmark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern regions of Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-red composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are usually basal, lanceolate, and covered with fine hairs. It is a relatively small plant, typically reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
